metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18313 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Perl before 5.26.3 has a buffer over-read via a crafted regular expression that triggers disclosure of sensitive information from process memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-fast-perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.7
libperl5.18 - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.7
perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.7
perl-base - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.7
perl-debug - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.7
perl-modules - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.2-2ubuntu1.7').
